Package com.rubynaxela.kyanite.game.assets

Class AudioHandler

java.lang.Object
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.game.assets.AudioHandler
public class AudioHandler extends Object
A sounds management utility class. Provides functionality for stopping or pausing/resuming all sounds, setting master volume and playing sounds in separate abstract channels that can have individual volume settings.

  • Method Details

    • pauseAllPlayingSounds

      public void pauseAllPlayingSounds()
      Pauses all sounds that were playing. They can be later resumed with the resumeAllPausedSounds() method.

    • pauseAllPlayingSounds

      public void pauseAllPlayingSounds(@NotNull @NotNull String channelName)
      Pauses all sounds that were playing in the specified channel. They can be later resumed with the resumeAllPausedSounds() method.

    • resumeAllPausedSounds

      public void resumeAllPausedSounds()
      Resumes all sounds that had been paused (not least with the pauseAllPlayingSounds() method).

    • resumeAllPausedSounds

      public void resumeAllPausedSounds(@NotNull @NotNull String channelName)
      Resumes all sounds in the specified channel.

    • stopAllSounds

      public void stopAllSounds()
      Stops all sounds that were playing.

    • stopAllSounds

      public void stopAllSounds(@NotNull @NotNull String channelName)
      Stops all sounds that were playing in the specified channel.

    • getMasterVolume

      public float getMasterVolume()
      Returns:
      current master volume setting

    • setMasterVolume

      public void setMasterVolume(float volume)
      Sets the global volume factor which is multiplied by the volume factors of the individual sounds. The volume is a percentage and ranges between 0 (silence) and 100 (full volume). The initial master volume is 100.
      Parameters:
      volume - the new master volume, ranging between 0 and 100

    • createChannel

      public void createChannel(@NotNull @NotNull String name)

    • getChannelVolume

      public float getChannelVolume(@NotNull @NotNull String channelName)
      Returns:
      current volume setting for the specified channel
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if channel of the specified name does not exist

    • setChannelVolume

      public void setChannelVolume(@NotNull @NotNull String channelName, float volume)
      Sets the volume factor for the specified channel, which is multiplied by the volume factors of the individual sounds. The volume is a percentage and ranges between 0 (silence) and 100 (full volume). The default channel volume is 100.
      Parameters:
      volume - the new master volume, ranging between 0 and 100
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if channel of the specified name does not exist

    • playSound

      public void playSound(@NotNull @NotNull Sound source, @NotNull @NotNull String channelName, float volume, float pitch)
      Plays a sound in the specified channel. Each time this method is called, a copy of the sound is created using the specified Sound object's buffer, thus each call may have a different volume and pitch setting without affecting the specified object's settings.
      Parameters:
      source - a Sound object
      channelName - the name of the channel
      volume - the volume of the sound, ranging between 0 (silence) and 100 (full volume)
      pitch - the pitch of the sound (values between 0 and 1 will pitch down the sound; values greater than 1 will pitch it up)

    • playSound

      public void playSound(@NotNull @AssetId @NotNull String id, @NotNull @NotNull String channelName, float volume, float pitch)
      Plays a sound in the specified channel. Each time this method is called, a copy of the sound is created using buffer of the Sound of the specified ID, thus each call may have a different volume and pitch setting without affecting that Sound object's settings.
      Parameters:
      id - ID of a Sound object from the assets bundle
      channelName - the name of the channel
      volume - the volume of the sound, ranging between 0 (silence) and 100 (full volume)
      pitch - the pitch of the sound (values between 0 and 1 will pitch down the sound; values greater than 1 will pitch it up)

    • gc

      public void gc()
      Garbage collection. This method clears all the sounds that have stopped playing. It is automatically called by the window loop.
